intro: Ptilotus axillaris, commonly known as the ghost flower, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its unique, feathery bracts that resemble ghostly shapes. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically green or yellowish in color. It is often found in sandy soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Ptilotus axillaris is also known for its ornamental value and is cultivated for its distinctive appearance.
